intro: Candollea scabrida, commonly known as the rough candollea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
